original: de yi spyod la rjes yi rang //

analyzed: de nas bu mo yul gyi bzang mo des pha de la tshigs su bcad de smras pa /
translated: Then his daughter, the local beauty, spoke to her father in verse:

original: yab cig dgongs shing shin tu dgongs par mdzod //
analyzed: yab cig dgongs shing shin tu dgongs par mdzod //
translated: “Father, think about this and think about it well.

original: bram ze'i tshig las 'gal bar ma mdzad cig /
analyzed: bram ze'i tshig las 'gal bar ma mdzad cig /

original: 'di 'dra'i las kyis bdag bskyed yab yum la'ang //
analyzed: 'di 'dra'i las kyis bdag bskyed yab yum la'ang //

analyzed: dbang mi mnga' bas khyim thab de stsol cig /
translated: and I am not my own mistress. Give me to that husband.”

original: de nas rgyal po dpal gyi snying po bu mo de'i tshig thos nas mgu zhing dga' la yid rangs te rab tu dga' zhing bde ba dang yid bde ba skyes nas bu mo yul gyi bzang mo de bram ze de la byin no //

translated: Then, having heard the words of the girl, King Śrīsena was pleased, delighted, and overjoyed. He was happy and joyful, and he gave the girl, the excellent woman of the land, to the brahmin.

analyzed: de nas bram ze des bu mo de blangs nas song ste bu bskyed nas chung ma dang bu bzhag ste yang rab @235a *// tu byung ngo //
translated: Then the brahmin took the girl and left. He raised a son and left his wife and son behind, and he went forth.

original: rgyal po des bram ze de'i bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba des gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams dang brtul zhugs 'dra bar skyes te /
analyzed: rgyal po des bram ze de'i bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba des gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams dang brtul zhugs 'dra bar skyes te /
translated: The king fulfilled the brahmin's wishes. By that root of virtue, he was reborn in the Heaven of Controlling Others' Emanations, with the same vows.

original: de 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i ris drug gi tshe'i tshad yongs su rdzogs par byas nas mir skyes pa na phyir mi 'phrog pa'i chos thams cad thob bo //
analyzed: de 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i ris drug gi tshe'i tshad yongs su rdzogs par byas nas mir skyes pa na phyir mi 'phrog pa'i chos thams cad thob bo //
translated: Having completed the lifespans of the six classes of gods in the desire realm, he was reborn as a human and attained all the irreversible dharmas.

original: moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /
translated: Maudgalyāyana,

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal po dpal gyi snying po zhes bya ba de gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal po dpal gyi snying po zhes bya ba de gzhan ma yin te /
translated: At that time, in that time, the king named Śrīgarbha was none other than me.

original: nga de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal po dpal gyi snying po zhes bya bar gyur to //
analyzed: nga de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal po dpal gyi snying po zhes bya bar gyur to //
translated: At that time, in that time, I was the king named Śrīgarbha.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba des nga gnas ma yin pa shes pa thob cing bdud kyi zhags pa thams cad kyis kyang phyir mi 'phrog go /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba des nga gnas ma yin pa shes pa thob cing bdud kyi zhags pa thams cad kyis kyang phyir mi 'phrog go /
translated: By that root of merit, I attained the knowledge of what is not possible and was not carried away by any of Māra’s snares.

original: moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /
translated: “Moreover, Maudgalyāyana,

original: des na / nga byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na sems can dpag tu med pa dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di yang dag par 'dzin du bcug pa'i dge ba rtsa ba des nga gnas ma yin pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa thob cing /
analyzed: des na / nga byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na sems can dpag tu med pa dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di yang dag par 'dzin du bcug pa'i dge ba rtsa ba des nga gnas ma yin pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa thob cing /
translated: when I was practicing bodhisattva conduct, I caused countless beings to take up this root of merit. By that root of merit, I attained the knowledge of the origin of the knowledge of what is not possible.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di'i rnam par smin pa la the tshom med de /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di'i rnam par smin pa la the tshom med de /
translated: I have no doubt about the ripening of this root of merit.

original: de'i las kyi rnam par smin pas nga gnas ma yin pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa thugs su chud /
analyzed: de'i las kyi rnam par smin pas nga gnas ma yin pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa thugs su chud /
translated: By the ripening of that karma, I realized the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of what is not possible.

original: mtshan dang dpe byad phun sum tshogs pa'ang brnyes so //
analyzed: mtshan dang dpe byad phun sum tshogs pa'ang brnyes so //
translated: and I also attained the excellent major and minor marks.

original: ngas gang gi tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di dag mngon par 'dus byas te sems can rnams dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di la bcug pa @235b des nga rab tu dga' ba gzhal du med pa skyes te /
analyzed: ngas gang gi tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di dag mngon par 'dus byas te sems can rnams dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di la bcug pa @235b des nga rab tu dga' ba gzhal du med pa skyes te /
translated: “When I had accumulated these roots of virtue and introduced sentient beings to these roots of virtue, I gave rise to an immeasurable joy.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba des nga gnas ma yin pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur pa'i lam shes pa thob ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba des nga gnas ma yin pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur pa'i lam shes pa thob ste /
translated: Through those roots of virtue, I attained the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of what is not a basis.

analyzed: shes pa gang dang ldan pas bdag dang sems can rnams kyi gnas ma yin pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa so sor shes so //
translated: With that knowledge, I understood the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of what is not a basis for myself and for sentient beings.

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so // gnas ma yin pa shes pa rgyur bcas dang // de bzhin 'gog dang lam dang sems can gyi //
translated: Then the Bhagavān spoke these verses:🔽“The knowledge of what is not a basis and its causes,

original: spyod dang bsam pa nges par de yi mthus //
analyzed: spyod dang bsam pa nges par de yi mthus //
translated: And likewise cessation, the path, and the conduct and thoughts of sentient beings,🔽Through the power of that knowledge,

translated: I know all investigation and analysis.

original: moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /

translated: The Thus-Gone One, while practicing the conduct of awakening for a long time, always had the cause of the perfect establishment of mindfulness. By the power of his faculty of mindfulness, he abided well and spoke for a long time, explaining for a long time.

original: moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /
translated: Maudgalyāyana,

original: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus 'khor ba dpag tu med pa na de bzhin gshegs pa 'jigs sgrog bla ma zhes bya ba nas rgya cher sbyar te /
analyzed: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus 'khor ba dpag tu med pa na de bzhin gshegs pa 'jigs sgrog bla ma zhes bya ba nas rgya cher sbyar te /
translated: in the past, innumerable eons ago, the Thus-Gone One, the foe-destroyer, the completely perfect Buddha called Bhīṣma-garjita-svara arose in the world.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi bar du 'jig rten du byung ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi bar du 'jig rten du byung ngo //
translated: He was a teacher of gods and humans, a buddha, a blessed one.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'jigs sgrog bla ma de'i rim gro ba dge slong yid du 'ong zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: The attendant of the Thus-Gone One Bhīṣma-garjita-svara was a monk called Manāpa.

analyzed: de la bye ba phrag drag cur de bzhin gshegs pa 'jigs sgrog bla ma de'i rim gro pa byas shing yid du @236a *//
translated: For forty million eons, he served the Thus-Gone One Bhīṣma-garjita-svara.

original: 'ong ste; yid du mi 'ong ba ma yin pas bshad pa'ang 'dzin la /
analyzed: 'ong ste; yid du mi 'ong ba ma yin pas bshad pa'ang 'dzin la /
translated: He was not unpleasant, so his explanations were accepted,

original: rang gi don kyang mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: rang gi don kyang mi gtong ngo //
translated: and he did not abandon his own purpose.

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi bskal pa gcig po de la sangs rgyas khri nyis stong byung ste /
translated: In that one eon of the buddha realm, twelve thousand buddhas appeared,

analyzed: de dag thams cad kyi rim gro par yang dge slong yid 'ong de gyur to //
translated: and the monk Manoharā became the attendant of all of them.

analyzed: de ltar phyis de bzhin gshegs pa stobs kyi shugs brnyes zhes bya ba byung ste /

analyzed: de'i rim gro par yang dge slong yid 'ong de gyur te /
translated: and the monk Manoharā became his attendant.

analyzed: de dge ba'i rtsa ba des lha dang mi rnams su skyes so //
translated: By that root of merit, he was reborn among gods and humans.

original: moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /

analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na dge slong yid 'ong zhes bya bar gyur pa de gzhan yin par sems na /

analyzed: de ltar mi blta ste /

analyzed: nga de'i tshe de'i dus na dge slong yid 'ong zhes bya bar gyur to //
translated: At that time, on that occasion, I was the monk named Manoharā.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba des nga 'das pa shes pa thob cing /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba des nga 'das pa shes pa thob cing /
translated: By that root of merit, after I attained awakening, I attained the knowledge of past lives.

analyzed: dran pa shes pa de ngas skye bo mang po yang dag par 'dzin du bcug cing /

analyzed: gzhan dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba la'ang yid dga' bas rjes su yid rangs te /

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba des nga 'das pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa brnyes so //
translated: Through those roots of virtue, I attained the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the past.

analyzed: thabs gang gis nga spyad pa spyod pa na de skye bo'i tshogs mang po shes pa de la rab tu bkod de /
translated: Through whatever means I practiced, I established many groups of beings in that knowledge.

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba @236b des nga 'das pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa brnyes so //
translated: Through those roots of virtue, I attained the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of the past.

original: moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /
translated: “Maudgalyāyana,

analyzed: nga ma 'ongs pa shes par bya ba'i don du sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na dka' ba mang po byas te /
translated: in the past, when I was practicing bodhisattva conduct in order to attain the knowledge of the future, I underwent many hardships.

analyzed: gtang bar dka' ba btang nas ji ltar ma 'ongs pa'i dus na bdag sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes mthong bar gyur cig snyam mo //
translated: Having given what is difficult to give, I will think, ‘In the future, may I see unobstructed wisdom.’

original: moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /
translated: “Maudgalyāyana,

analyzed: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus 'khor ba dpag tu med pa na de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes gsal ba'i sgron ma zhes bya ba 'jig rten du byung ste /
translated: in the past, infinite eons ago, the thus-gone Wisdom Lamp appeared in the world.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes gsal ba'i sgron ma de'i 'khor nyan thos 'bum byung ngo //

translated: When he taught the Dharma to the hearers about the future, a monk named Always Diligent was present in the retinue. He thought,🔽“

analyzed: kye ae ma bdag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes mthong ba dang ldan par gyur cig snyam nas de de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes gsal ba'i sgron ma de la gser gyi me tog chen po mngon par gtor te smon lam btab pa
translated: “ ‘Ah! In the future, may I have the vision of unobstructed wisdom!’ He then scattered great golden flowers upon the thus-gone Lamp of the Light of Wisdom and made the following aspiration:

analyzed: / kye ae ma bdag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'di lta bu'i ye shes skye bar gyur cig ces btab ste /
translated: ‘Ah! In the future, may I give rise to such wisdom!’

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba des nga ma 'ongs pa shes pa brnyes so //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba des nga ma 'ongs pa shes pa brnyes so //
translated: “ ‘By that root of virtue, I attained the knowledge of the future.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba des kyang nga rten cing 'brel par @237a *//🔽'byung ba mkhyen te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba des kyang nga rten cing 'brel par @237a *// 'byung ba mkhyen te /
translated: “ ‘By that root of virtue, I also came to know dependent origination.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba des nga ma 'ongs pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa brnyes so //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba des nga ma 'ongs pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa brnyes so //
translated: “ ‘By that root of virtue, I attained the knowledge of the origin of the knowledge of the future.

original: rgyu dang rkyen gang zhig yod na /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gang zhig yod na /
translated: What are the causes and conditions

original: ma 'ongs pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub kyi /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par 'grub kyi /
translated: for the perfect accomplishment of the knowledge of the origin of the knowledge of the future?

original: de'i rgyu med na /
analyzed: de'i rgyu med na /
translated: If there are no such causes,

original: de lta bu rab tu shes par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bu rab tu shes par mi 'gyur te /
translated: such knowledge will not arise.🔽“ ‘

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba des nga ma 'ongs pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa mngon sum du byas so //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba des nga ma 'ongs pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa mngon sum du byas so //
translated: Through that root of virtue, I manifested the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the future.

original: nga mchog tu dga' ba gang gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la bstan te /
analyzed: nga mchog tu dga' ba gang gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la bstan te /
translated: I taught those bodhisattva mahāsattvas with supreme joy.

analyzed: shes pa de mngon par dga' zhing yongs su dag pa'i tshul khrims kyi dge ba'i rtsa bas nga ma 'ongs pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa brnyes so //
translated: Through the pure roots of virtue of that knowledge, I attained the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of the present.

original: moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /
translated: “Moreover, Maudgalyāyana,

analyzed: gzhan yang da ltar byung ba'i shes pa bsgrub pa'i don du dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa sna tshogs du ma dag mngon par 'dus byas te /
translated: in order to accomplish the knowledge of the present, I accumulated various roots of virtue.

original: moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /
translated: “Moreover, Maudgalyāyana,

original: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus 'khor ba dpag tu med pa'i pha rol na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mtha' yas spyan zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi bar 'jig rten du byung ste; de 'khor brgya
analyzed: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus 'khor ba dpag tu med pa'i pha rol na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mtha' yas spyan zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi bar 'jig rten du byung ste; de 'khor brgya
translated: “In the past, infinite eons ago, there appeared in the world a thus-gone one, a worthy one, a perfect buddha called Infinite Eyes.🔽

original: stong du mas yongs su bskor cing mdun gyis bltas pa la da ltar byung ba'i dus las brtsams te chos ston to //
analyzed: stong du mas yongs su bskor cing mdun gyis bltas pa la da ltar byung ba'i dus las brtsams te chos ston to //
translated: “In the past, infinite eons ago, there was a thus-gone one, a worthy one, a perfect buddha called Infinite Eyes. He was a blessed buddha who appeared in the world and was surrounded by a retinue of many thousands. He taught the Dharma, beginning with the present time.

original: de'i tshe bram ze blo ldan zhes bya @237b ba shing s'a la chen po lta bu zhig kyang de'i 'khor nyid du 'dus te 'dug par gyur to //
analyzed: de'i tshe bram ze blo ldan zhes bya @237b ba shing s'a la chen po lta bu zhig kyang de'i 'khor nyid du 'dus te 'dug par gyur to //
translated: At that time, there was a wise brahmin called Intelligent, who was like a great sāla tree. He was also present in that assembly.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi spobs pa thogs pa med pas da ltar gyi dus las brtsams nas chos ston pa bram ze blo ldan shing s'a la chen po lta bus thos so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spobs pa thogs pa med pas da ltar gyi dus las brtsams nas chos ston pa bram ze blo ldan shing s'a la chen po lta bus thos so //
translated: The Blessed One, with his unimpeded eloquence, taught the Dharma beginning with the present time. The brahmin Intelligent, who was like a great sāla tree, heard it.

analyzed: de skye ba dang / rga ba dang / nad dang / 'chi ba las yang dag par 'da' ba'i chos ston to //

analyzed: zhes de skad thos te / khyed cag tshur shog /

analyzed: de nas gzhon nu zhi ba'i blo gros srog chags bye ba phrag drug dang lhan cig tu de bzhin gshegs pa khrid mdzad de ga la ba der dong ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa de'i zhabs la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te phyogs gcig tu
translated: Then Prince Śamatamati, together with six hundred million living beings, went to where the Tathāgata was residing. Having arrived, he bowed his head at the feet of that Blessed Tathāgata and sat to one side.

analyzed: rgyal po gzhon nu zhi ba'i blo gros phyogs gcig tu 'dug pas de bzhin gshegs pa de la tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis zhu ba zhus pa /

analyzed: shin tu dri med thugs zhi lhar bcas pa'i //

analyzed: @243b 'jig rten khrid mdzad khyod la zhu ba ni //

original: gzhon nu'i tshig des shin tu yon tan ldan //
analyzed: gzhon nu'i tshig des shin tu yon tan ldan //

analyzed: 'gro ba nye bar nyon mongs mi shes so // skyes ma thag tu sngon gyi las kyis su //
